au.rmit.ract.planning.pathplanning.ai.heuristics
Interface DistanceHeuristics

All Superinterfaces:
Heuristics
All Known Implementing Classes:
DynamicHeuristics, EuclideanDistanceHeuristics, ManhattanDistanceHeuristics
public interface DistanceHeuristics
extends Heuristics

A distance based heuristics which is mostly applicable in geometric world.

Author:
Abhijeet Anand (abhijeet [dot] anand [at] rmit [dot] edu [dot] au)

Method Summary
 float h(SearchDomain map, State cNode, State gNode)
          The heuristic cost between two nodes in a map.
 boolean updateH(SearchDomain map, State cNode, State gNode, float hModifier)
          Updates the heuristic cost between two nodes in a map.
 

Method Detail

h

float h(SearchDomain map,
        State cNode,
        State gNode)
The heuristic cost between two nodes in a map. A heuristics cost is an approximation of cost of traversing from the current node to the target node. This value is usually calculated between the current node and the goal node.

Parameters:
map - SearchDomain to be queried for distance values
cNode - The current State
gNode - The goal State
Returns:
A heuristic cost between the current and goal node.

updateH

boolean updateH(SearchDomain map,
                State cNode,
                State gNode,
                float hModifier)
Updates the heuristic cost between two nodes in a map. A heuristics cost is an approximation of cost of traversing from the current node to the target node. This value is usually calculated/updated between the current node and the goal node. This method in particular is provided for the use of learning real time algorithms, such as LRTA*, LSS-LRTA* and others, which update the heuristic value as they learn more about the topology of the map.

Parameters:
map - SearchDomain to be queried for updating the distance value
cNode - The current State
gNode - The goal State
hModifier - The value by which the original heuristics of the current node should be modified
Returns:
true if the map successfully updates the h-value;
false otherwise.
